chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M Bowers

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Jason M Bowers in court.  Attorney Richard David Gorman in court for Jason M Bowers.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
Formal reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Attorney Gorman relates and that there will be an agreement. Plea date set and DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR IN PERSON.  Address and phone number confirmed.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:30 PM Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason M Bowers appeared by video.  Attorney Richard David Gorman appeared by video for Jason M Bowers. Attorney Gorman relates and requests waiver of prelim.  Court performs colloquy and finds waiver is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently given and binds over.  Parties must appear in person to next hearing. Notice to be sent to DE.
Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
1 - Messages. Exhibit was not offered nor received by the court on 6/13/22.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 034402,
Payable Number: 126699,
Receipt Number: 22RP001288,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
May have no contact with minors under 18 except his own children, unless in the presence of parent or guardian.
DE is prohibited from using a personal computer or any electronic device with internet access.

1:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason M Bowers appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Knaak appears by video and will represent for today.  State relates regarding DE obtaining legal representation from an attorney out of MN.  Attorney Margaret Cook appears by Zoom video for DE.  Parties enter a breakout room. Parties may appear by Zoom to Preliminary Examination.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
